name: Scene

methods.name: Scene
methods.content: Creates a new `Scene` object to be played in The Theater. A `Scene` is a set of steps of animation, such as drawing an image, text or a shape. A `Scene` can also include sound, like playing a sound file or musical notes.

methods.name: getWidth
methods.content: Returns the width of the canvas in pixels.

methods.name: getHeight
methods.content: Returns the height of the canvas in pixels.

methods.name: clear
methods.content: Clears the canvas and sets the background color to the specified color name. If the name provided does not match a known color or hex value, this method will set the background to black.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the name of the color to use as the color of the canvas"}]

methods.name: clear
methods.content: Clears the canvas and sets the background color to the specified `Color`.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"Color","required":true,"description":"the color to use as the background color of the canvas\n\nSee the documentation for the [**Color**](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/Color) class to see the options available."}]

methods.name: playSound
methods.content: Plays the sound referenced by the specified filename.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"filename","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the filename of the sound to play"}]

methods.name: playSound
methods.content: Plays an array of sound samples provided.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"sound","type":"double[]","required":true,"description":"the array of sound samples to play"}]

methods.name: playNote
methods.content: Plays a note with the default `Instrument` (`Instrument.PIANO`).
methods.parameters: [{"name":"note","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the note to play\n\nThe note `60` represents middle C on a piano."},{"name":"seconds","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the length of the note"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void playNote(int note, double seconds)`

methods.name: playNote
methods.content: Plays a note with the specified `Instrument`.
methods.parameters:
[{"name":"instrument ","type":"Instrument","required":true,"description":"the `Instrument` to use to play the note

See the documentation for the [Instrument class](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/Instrument) to see the options available."},{"name":"note","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the note to play

The note `60` represents middle C on a piano."},{"name":"seconds","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the length of the note"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void playNote(Instrument instrument, int note, double seconds)`

methods.name: playNoteAndPause
methods.content: Plays a note with the default `Instrument` (`Instrument.PIANO`) and adds a pause in the `Scene` for the duration of the note, so that subsequent play commands begin after the note has finished playing.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"note","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the note to play\n\nThe note `60` represents middle C on a piano."},{"name":"seconds","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the length of the note"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void playNoteAndPause(int note, double seconds)`

methods.name: playNoteAndPause
methods.content: Plays a note with the specified `Instrument` and adds a pause in the `Scene` for the duration of the note, so that subsequent play commands begin after the note has finished playing.
methods.parameters:
[{"name":"instrument","type":"Instrument","required":true,"description":"the `Instrument` to use to play the note

See the documentation for the [Instrument class](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/Instrument) to see the options available."},{"name":"note ","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the note to play

The note `60` represents middle C on a piano."},{"name":"seconds","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the length of the note"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void playNoteAndPause(Instrument instrument, int note, double seconds)`

methods.name: pause
methods.content: Waits the provided number of seconds before performing the next draw or play command.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"seconds","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the number of seconds to wait\n\nThis can be a fraction of a second, but the smallest value can be `0.1` seconds."}]

methods.name: drawImage
methods.content: Draws a specified image at the given x and y coordinate. The specified size sets the width of the image in pixels. The height will stretch to make sure the image does not appear distorted.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"filename","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the filename of the image to draw"},{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the image from the left side of the image"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the image from the top of the image"},{"name":"size","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the width of the image in pixels"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawImage(String filename, int x, int y, int size)`

methods.name: drawImage
methods.content: Draws a specified image at the given x and y coordinate. The specified size sets the width of the image in pixels. The height will stretch to make sure the image does not appear distorted. The specified rotation sets how much to rotate the image.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"filename","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the filename of the image to draw"},{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the image from the left side of the image"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the image from the top of the image"},{"name":"size","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the width of the image in pixels"},{"name":"rotation","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the amount to rotate the image in degrees"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawImage(String filename, int x, int y, int size, double rotation)`

methods.name: drawImage
methods.content: Draws a specified image at the given x and y coordinate with a given width and height. The specified rotation sets how much to rotate the image.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"filename","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the filename of the image to draw"},{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the image from the left side of the image"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the image from the top of the image"},{"name":"width","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the width to set the image"},{"name":"height","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the height to set the image"},{"name":"rotation","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the amount to rotate the image in degrees"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawImage(String filename, int x, int y, int width, int height, double rotation)`

methods.name: drawImage
methods.content: Draws a specified `Image` object at the given x and y coordinate. The specified size sets the width of the image in pixels. The height will stretch to make sure the image does not appear distorted.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"image","type":"Image","required":true,"description":"the `Image` object to draw"},{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the image from the left side of the image"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the image from the top of the image"},{"name":"size","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the width of the image in pixels"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawImage(Image image, int x, int y, int size)`

methods.name: drawImage
methods.content: Draws a specified `Image` object at the given x and y coordinate. The specified size sets the width of the image in pixels. The height will stretch to make sure the image does not appear distorted. The specified rotation sets how much to rotate the image.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"image","type":"Image","required":true,"description":"the `Image` object to draw"},{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the image from the left side of the image"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the image from the top of the image"},{"name":"size","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the width of the image in pixels"},{"name":"rotation","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the amount to rotate the image in degrees"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawImage(Image image, int x, int y, int size, double rotation)`

methods.name: drawImage
methods.content: Draws a specified `Image` object at the given x and y coordinate with a given width and height. The specified rotation sets how much to rotate the image.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"image","type":"Image","required":true,"description":"the `Image` object to draw"},{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the image from the left side of the image"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the image from the top of the image"},{"name":"width","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the width to set the image"},{"name":"height","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the height to set the image"},{"name":"rotation","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the amount to rotate the image in degrees"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawImage(Image image, int x, int y, int width, int height, double rotation)`

methods.name: setTextStyle
methods.content: Sets the `Font` and `FontStyle` to draw the text.
methods.parameters:
[{"name":"font","type":"Font","required":true,"description":"the font to draw with

See the documentation for the [**Font**](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/Font) class to see the options available."},{"name":"style","type":"FontStyle","required":true,"description":"the style of the font

See the documentation for the [**FontStyle**](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/FontStyle) class to see the options available."}]

methods.name: setTextHeight
methods.content: Sets the height of the text in pixels.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"height","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the height in pixels of the text to draw"}]

methods.name: setTextColor
methods.content: Sets the color of the text. If the specified name of the color cannot be found, the default color is used.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the name of the color to use"}]

methods.name: setTextColor
methods.content: Sets the color of the text.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"Color","required":true,"description":"the `Color` object to use to set the color of the text\n\nSee the documentation for the [**Color**](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/Color) class to see the options available."}]

methods.name: drawText
methods.content: Draws text on the canvas.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"text","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the text to draw"},{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the text"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the text"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawText(String text, int x, int y)`

methods.name: drawText
methods.content: Draws text on the canvas.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"text","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the text to draw on the canvas"},{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the text"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the text"},{"name":"rotation","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the amount to rotate the text in degrees around its center"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawText(String text, int x, int y, double rotation)`

methods.name: drawLine
methods.content: Draws a line on the canvas.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"startX","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the line"},{"name":"startY","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the line"},{"name":"endX","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to stop drawing the line"},{"name":"endY","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to stop drawing the line"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawLine(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)`

methods.name: drawRegularPolygon
methods.content: Draws a regular polygon (triangle, square, pentagon, hexagon, etc.) on the canvas.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate for the center of the polygon"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate for the center of the polygon"},{"name":"sides","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the number of sides of the polygon"},{"name":"radius","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the distance from the center to each point on the polygon"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawRegularPolygon(int x, int y, int sides, int radius)`

methods.name: drawShape
methods.content: Draws a shape by connecting the points provided.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"points","type":"int[]","required":true,"description":"an array of numbers for the x and y coordinates of each point formatted as `[x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, . . .]`"},{"name":"close","type":"boolean","required":true,"description":"whether to close the shape\n\nIf this is set to `true`, the last point and the first point will be connected by a line. If a fill color is set, the shape will be filled with that color."}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawShape(int[] points, boolean close)`

methods.name: drawEllipse
methods.content: Draws an ellipse (an oval or a circle) on the canvas.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the left side of the ellipse"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the top of the ellipse"},{"name":"width","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the width of the ellipse"},{"name":"height","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the height of the ellipse"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawEllipse(int x, int y, int width, int height)`

methods.name: drawRectangle
methods.content: Draws a rectangle on the canvas.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"x","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the x coordinate to start drawing the left side of the rectangle"},{"name":"y","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the y coordinate to start drawing the top of the rectangle"},{"name":"width","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the width of the rectangle"},{"name":"height","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the height of the rectangle"}]
methods.syntax: `public final void drawRectangle(int x, int y, int width, int height)`

methods.name: setStrokeWidth
methods.content: Sets the thickness of lines drawn.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"width","type":"double","required":true,"description":"the width in pixels of the line to draw\n\nA width of `0` means no line."}]

methods.name: setFillColor
methods.content: Sets the fill color for all shapes drawn. If the name of the color cannot be found, no fill color will be used.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the name of the color to fill the shape"}]

methods.name: setFillColor
methods.content: Sets the fill color for all shapes drawn.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"Color","required":true,"description":"the `Color` object to use to fill the shape\n\nSee the documentation for the [Color class](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/Color) to see the options available."}]

methods.name: setStrokeColor
methods.content: Sets the color of the lines drawn. If the name of the color cannot be found, no color is used for the stroke.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the name of the color to use for the lines drawn"}]

methods.name: setStrokeColor
methods.content: Sets the color of the lines drawn.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"Color","required":true,"description":"the `Color` object to use to set the color of the lines drawn\n\nSee the documentation for the [Color class](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/Color) to see the options available."}]

methods.name: removeStrokeColor
methods.content: Removes the stroke color so all shapes have no stroke.

methods.name: removeFillColor
methods.content: Removes the fill color so all shapes drawn have no fill.
